Interface for collecting drive data and validate drive data based on

instructions provided in config file

and validated

be in group 1 of regex pattern

DriveFirmwareUpdate Module¶

class havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.drive_firmware_update.DriveFirmwareUpdate[source]¶

Bases: havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.storage_test_base.StorageTestBase

Drive Firmware Update

Test installing drive firmware and validate installation. Optionally perform IO after firmware update.

Parameters

  • versions (list of str) – Firmware version to find and install on test drives.

  • cycle (Integer) – How many times to perform the upgrade/downgrade cycle.

  • verify_io (Boolean) – If set to True will perform IO on test drives post firmware update.

  • fio_template (String) – Path to fio_template file to be used.

  • fio_options (Dictionary) – Mapping of entries to fill in the given template file.

Example

Sample control file:
{

“cycle”: 2, “versions”: [“stable”, “latest”], “verify_io”: true, “fio_template”: “basic_verify.job”, “fio_options”: {

“RW”:”randrw”, “BLKSIZE”:”128k”, “SIZE”:”10G”, “RUNTIME”:”30m”, “DEPTH”:”128”, “VERIFY”: “crc32c”

}

}

_get_bin_path(bin_name, drive)[source]¶

Gets Binary file Path.

This method gets binary file for a firmware in a common location for a given model.

Firmware binary path follows this format:

<siteutils_firmware_path>/<drive_type>/<vendor>/<MODEL>/fw_binary/<bin_name>

Parameters

  • bin_name (String) – Binary file name for the corresponding firmware.

  • drive – The drive’s name present in the host for the specific drive type.

Returns

bin_path – Binary file path for the given firmware.

Return type

String

_get_firmware_info(version, drive)[source]¶

Gets Drive’s Firmware Information.

This method pulls firmware information from firmware mapping file.

Parameters

  • version (String) – Drive’s firmware version value.

  • drive – The drive’s name present in the host for the specific drive type.

Returns

fw_info – Drive’s Firmware information related to the version.

Return type

Dictionary

_get_firmware_map(drive)[source]¶

Gets Firmware map.

This method Pulls firmware information from a JSON file in the firmware path.

Parameters

drive – The drive’s name present in the host for the specific drive type.

Returns

fw_info – Content of drive model’s fw_version_map.json.

Return type

Dictionary

Raises

TestError – When fails to load the json file.

_get_firmware_path(drive)[source]¶

Gets Firmware Binaries file Path.

This method uses drive data to determine its firmware directory. The returned directory should contains firmware binaries and a json file which map a version to a binary file.

Parameters

drive – The drive’s name present in the host for the specific drive type.

Example

Sample fw_version_map.json:
{
“latest”: {

“name”: “EDA72F2Q”, “bin”: “EDA72F2Q.bin”, “md5”: “”

}, “stable”: {

“name”: “CXV96F1Q”, “bin”: “CXV96F1Q.bin”, “md5”: “”

},

}

Returns

bin_file_path – Constructed binary file path with vendor and model details.

Return type

String

Raises

TestError – When unsupported drive type is mentioned.

_run_io()[source]¶

Creates and Runs FIO job file.

This method installs FIO, creates the basic_verify job file and runs IO on test drives. After successful FIO run, parses the output file for any error.

Raises

TestStepError – When fails to - Installs FIO - Creates job file - Runs job file - Parsing the output file for FIO.

execute()[source]¶

This method gets the test drive details, using firmware information from fw_version_map.json, constructs the binary file path, updates the firmware based on the binary file path and verifies IO using FIO job.

Raises

TestError – When fails to update the firmware for the drive.

test_firmware_update(drive, fw_versions)[source]¶

Firmware update

This method installs firmware for a drive and verifies if installation is successful.

Parameters

  • drive – The drive’s name present in the host for the specific drive type.

  • fw_versions (list of str) – List of firmware to install on DUT.

Raises

  • TestStepError – When comparison fails between expected and actual values of MD5 Checksum and

  • Firmware version values. –

abstract update_drive_firmware()[source]¶

command once and cache its output to avoid repeated call for each drive

StorageTestBase Module¶

exception havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.storage_test_base.DriveValidationException[source]¶

Bases: Exception

class havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.storage_test_base.StorageTestBase[source]¶

Bases: havoc.autoval.lib.test_base.TestBase

Base class for testing drives.

  • Create drive objects

  • Compare and validate drive metrics at the end of the test

Test control params:

String[] drives: list of drive names to test: e.g. sdac, sdf, String drive_type: hdd, ssd, etc. String drive_interface: filter for drives with this interface

to test

String drive_model: test drives with this given model String drive_count: if provided, will validate if the number

of test drives equal this value

String drive_config: json file that controls how drive data is

collected and validated

Boolean validate_bootdrive_smart: whether to validate boot drive String validate_firmware: if provided, will check if test drives’

firmware matches this value

_collect_drive_data()[source]¶

Collect current drives’ data for before/after comparison and validation

@return {}: dictionary that map drive serial number -> drive_snapshot object

_compare_drive_data(validate_config, before_dict, after_dict)[source]¶
Usees instructions from validate_config dictionary and to compare drive

SMART data before and after the test

@param {} validate_config @param {} before_dict @param {} after_dict

_compare_drive_data_field(before, actual, field, instr)[source]¶
Parse a validate instruction and perform comparison on before vs. actual

values of a field. Supported operations: ‘<’ -> less than ‘>’ -> greater than ‘>=’-> greater than equal to ‘<=’-> less than equal to ‘=’ -> check equality, similar to == ‘-‘ -> in-between range (lower_val is required) ‘/’ -> multiple options (existence of word in a string) ‘~’ -> increment the ‘expected’ by “increment_by” and compare

@param string/numeric before, actual: @param string field @param string instr: e.g. “>80”, “==”

_filter_drive_by_attr(drives, attr, value)[source]¶

Return drives in a list that has an attribute equal a provided value

@param String attr: attribute to compare @param Enum/String value: drive is included if attribute has this value @return Drive[]

_remove_partitions()[source]¶
Remove all partitions and unmount all drives, except for boot drive.

Running fio on a raw device would fail if attempted on an already mounted device. Unmount the filesystem before starting the tests.

cleanup(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Filter drives that meet provided criteria for testing

@param

String drive_type - hdd, ssd, md String interface - nvme, sas, sata String model - drive model

@return - dict of logical name -> Drive
